utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Thank you guys for having us over.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh! Yeah, this is fun, couples night.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, I don't know why we hang out with married couples more often.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, because every time we do, you make jokes about swinging and scare them away.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You mean that Portuguese couple? Yeah, like you wouldn't have done it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, you guys... I have great news.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ross, we're kind of in the middle of diner here.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, well, er, I already ate, but sure...! Guess what happened at work today...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: A dinosaur died a million years ago?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Try sixty-five million years ago, and then try sssshhhhhh.... My tenure review board met today and I hear it's looking really good.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah. Do you have any idea what this means in academic circles, uh? I am gonna get laid.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi you guys.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ooh, Italian!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No one wanted seconds, right?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, no. I-I'm good.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey you guys... You're never gonna believe it. This headhunter called me. I have a meeting tomorrow with Gucci. Gucci wants me.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I'm up for tenure.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Congratulations!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You too! What are the odds?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ooh!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Guess what? I finally got that seed out of my teeth.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I don't know who I'm happiest for...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I do, he's been working on that all day!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey Mon? Was it weird changing your name to Geller-Bing?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, no. It felt nice to acknowledge this.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Where did you go to do it?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Uhm the... the ministry... of names... bureau...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: YOU NEVER DID IT!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I'm sorry. It's just the idea of being an official Bing.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey! I will have you know that... aah, who am I kidding. Let's call the kid Geller and let Bing die with me.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Here you go.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Thanks! Honey, would you want me to take your name?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Oh, it's just... It's up to you. It's your name. You've got to live with it.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All right, let's see, call me Mrs. Hannigan.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Mrs. Hannigan?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What? Can't you see I'm in the middle of something? Ooh, I like it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey guys.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey Joe! We've got a couple of things we've got to check out at the new house. You want to come with us?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, thank you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right. I know you're not happy about us moving, but you're the only one who hasn't seen the house.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, come with us. You'll see how close it is to the city.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: But no, it's not close. You said it was in escrow? I couldn't even find it on the map.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey, please come. It would mean so much to us.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You know what? You are my friends, I wanna be supportive, I will come with you. SHOTGUN!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Damn it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: See you guys later.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I'll pick you up at eleven. So glad you're coming.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Good for you. That was really mature.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What? No, the only reason I'm going to their stupid new house, is so I can point out everything that's wrong with it, so they don't move. I'm gonna make them stay here.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: You're a strange kind of grown-up.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Joey, you can't make someone do something they don't want to do. Believe me, there's something I've been trying to get Mike to do in bed and there's... he's just...

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Woo-wo-hey-hey-hey... Can we not talk about that right now?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All right, prude... Look, Monica and Chandler really love this house. You are not gonna talk them into staying here.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, hey... I can convince people to do anything, you know. I bet I can even get Mike to do that "thing". What is it?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I AM NOT GONNA HELP YOU DO THAT! Goodbye!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi, I'm here to see Mr. Campbell... with Gucci. The reservation is probably under Gucci. It's spelled like Gukki, which could be confusing.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God! That's my boss. You have to seat us somewhere else.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: But my... but my boss cannot see me. I'm interviewing for another job.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Sssshhhh!

utterance.speaker: Mr Zellner
utterance.content: Rachel?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi... I'm on a date...

utterance.speaker: Mr Zellner
utterance.content: That's great!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, it is. Yeah, you know, it's tough. Single mom, career... You gotta get out there.

utterance.speaker: Mr Zellner
utterance.content: Well, you got uhm... good energy.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Mr Campbell
utterance.content: Rachel?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes, hi!

utterance.speaker: Mr Campbell
utterance.content: James Campbell...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi! Excuse us.

utterance.speaker: Mr Campbell
utterance.content: Please...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay. Oh, yeah... Oh he's cute!

utterance.speaker: Mr Campbell
utterance.content: So... your resumé is quite impressive.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wha... My resumé? I wouldn't... I wouldn't call my online dating profile a resumé.

utterance.speaker: Mr Campbell
utterance.content: Dating profile? I-I-I'm talking about the work resumé.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Whatever happened to just singing for no reason? Huh?

utterance.speaker: Mr Campbell
utterance.content: Maybe people... found it weird.... So, why do you want to leave Ralph Lauren?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What? I-I don't.

utterance.speaker: Mr Campbell
utterance.content: You don't?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, I-I-I love it there.

utterance.speaker: Mr Campbell
utterance.content: Well, if you don't want to leave, why are we having this lunch?

utterance.speaker: Mr Campbell
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Mr Campbell
utterance.content: That's Hugo Boss?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: This place is so depressing. If I had to work here I'd kill myself. But you obviously haven't.

utterance.speaker: Clerk
utterance.content: How can I help you?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I need to change my name, please. See, I need to change it because I'm-I'm hiding from the law. You're fun.

utterance.speaker: Clerk
utterance.content: You need to fill out this form.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, well, I just don't, I don't know how it works exactly. See, my name is Buffay and my husband's name is Hannigan, so is it supposed to be Buffay-Hannigan or Hannigan-Buffay?

utterance.speaker: Clerk
utterance.content: It can be anything you want.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, not anything, I mean...

utterance.speaker: Clerk
utterance.content: Yeah... anything.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, this could take a while.

utterance.speaker: Clerk
utterance.content: Get out of my line.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey Pheebs.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, not anymore. I changed it today.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, I'm sorry, Mrs. Hannigan.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wrong again! Apparently you can change it to anything you want. So I thought, all right, here's an opportunity to be creative. So meet Princess Consuela Banana Hammock.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That's what we were gonna name the baby.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Phoebe!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uh! Princess Consuela.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You seriously changed your name to that?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uh-huh!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, so from now on we have to call you Princess Consuela?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uhm, no. I'm gonna have my friends call me Valerie.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, how'd the interview go?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh! It's not good.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You know, I always feel that way after an interview. I'll bet it went better than you think.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, I didn't get the job at Gucci and I got fired from Ralph Lauren.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That is a bad interview.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What are you, what are you talking about? How did this happen?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, my boss was at the same restaurant where I was having my interview and he heard everything. So later he calls me to his office and he tells me that he's gonna have to let me go, because I'm not a team player. And I said "Wait a minute! Yes I am." and I had to sit there for 45 minutes while he proved that that in fact... was true.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh God. I'm so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey! Wha-hoo! What's this? Well it's a, it's a bottle of champagne. Why is this here?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ross...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I guess it's here because I GOT TENURE!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: This is the single greatest day of my professional career. Gunther, six glasses!

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: Six? You want me to join you?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, I thought Joey was here. Five is good. Well, I'm gonna have a loogie in my coffee tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ooh! Israeli champagne. And it's vanilla!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I got tenure. I didn't win the lottery... Hey Rach, so uh... how did your thing go?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh it... good! Yeah, but I'm not gonna hear from that for a couple of days.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, you know what? You're gonna get it. I-I-I-I can feel it.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Can you?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ah, all right. Here's to Ross!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And-and to years of hard work finally paying off.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: And to knowing that your career doesn't mean everything.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: But also knowing it means a lot.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: But more importantly to full well-rounded lives.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: ...that center around work.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: To Ross!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You know what the best part about this is? I can never be fired.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh God!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No seriously. I have job security for life. You know, I never have to worry. Oh, look at you. Look how happy you are for me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, it's not that. I got fired today. And I didn't get the other job.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Rach, I'm so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Great. I feel like an idiot.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, it's okay, you didn't know.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh... Little heads-up would have been nice.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Thank you for letting us see the house again.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And thank you for explaining to us what escrow means... I've already forgotten what you said, but thank you.

utterance.speaker: Realtor
utterance.content: Take as long as you want. Just let me know when you're through.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ah, so glad you decided to come.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Me too. Yeah, this place is great. I'm so happy for you guys. Although, you know, I hope you like fungus.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Fungus! Yeah. Place is full of it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No it's not. We had an inspection and they didn't find anything.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay. Then I guess I have dry eyes and a scratchy throat for no reason.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Maybe because it's you hung your head out of the window like a dog the whole ride here.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Maybe. So this is the living room huh? Ooh, it's pretty dark.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No it's not!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Are you kiddin'? I think I just saw a bat in the corner!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: When your head was hanging out the window, it didn't hit a mailbox, did it?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Maybe. Well, I just think you guys can do better than this house, you know? Or any other house for that matter.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh Joey, look, we know you're having a hard time with this, but we really, we love it here.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: FINE, ok, if you love this house so much, then you should just live here, okay? I just hope you get used to that weird humming sound. Hmmmmmmmmmmmmmm...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey, we know that's you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: no... hmmmmm... it's not... hmmmmmmmmmm

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Hey

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Welcome back!

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Ah! I missed you

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, me too!

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: So, what's new?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, I'm no longer Phoebe Buffay.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: That's great! You changed you name?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yes I did! Meet: Princess Consuela Banana Hammock!

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: You're kidding right?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: You really did that?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Yeah, but you can't do that.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Why? It's fun, it's different, no-one else has a name like it.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Alright, then I'm gonna change my name.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Great, okay, what are you gonna change it to?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Crap Bag.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: No, no Mike, just Crap Bag. First name Crap, last name Bag.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You're not serious, right?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Yeah, I'm serious. It's fun, it's different and no-one else has a name like that!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uhu, uhu, well, then, great. If you love it, I love it.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: I do love it, and I love your name. I love Princess Consuela.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: And I love Crap.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ow!

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Who are you?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, hi, I'm Joey. My stupid friends are buying this house. Who are you?

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: I'm Mackenzie. My stupid parents are selling this house.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Mackenzie
utterance.content: I hate my parents.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I hate my friends. Alright, look. There's gotta be a way that we can stop this from happening.

utterance.speaker: Mackenzie
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uhm... oh! Okay. You come with me, and you tell them that the house is haunted!

utterance.speaker: Mackenzie
utterance.content: What are you? Eight?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Woah, uh! Okay, let's hear your great idea.

utterance.speaker: Mackenzie
utterance.content: I don't have any great ideas. I am eight.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ahh! There's gotta be a way. I mean, you know, if Monica and Chandler move out here and now Phoebe is married to Mike. That just leaves me and Ross and Rach, you know what I mean?

utterance.speaker: Mackenzie
utterance.content: I really don't.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What am I gonna do, I feel like I'm losing my friends.

utterance.speaker: Mackenzie
utterance.content: My parents say I'm gonna make new friends.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, sure, easy for you, you're young. Me, I'm set in my ways.

utterance.speaker: Mackenzie
utterance.content: This is what my mom was talking about. Whiners are wieners. Look, you want your friends to be happy, right?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, I guess.

utterance.speaker: Mackenzie
utterance.content: Well, if moving here is gonna make them happy, don't you want them to do it?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, maybe.

utterance.speaker: Mackenzie
utterance.content: Then you gotta let them go.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I hate to admit it, but you're probably right. How did you get to be so smart?

utterance.speaker: Mackenzie
utterance.content: I read a lot.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Just when I thought we could be friends.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Hey Rach, I just heard. I'm so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, thank you...

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: You still don't know my name, do you?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, now I don't have to.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross, what is taking you so long?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I'm sorry, it's almost as if this wasn't built for a quick getaway!

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: Rachel?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Mark? Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: How've you been?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I'm fantastic. You remember Ross?

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: Sure, sure. What's with the chair.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh, you know, you can't always get a seat on the subway, so...

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: Clever. So how are you?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, well, you're not catching me on my best day.

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: Yeah, a box full of your desk stuff doesn't exactly say big promotion.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, but it's good, you know, I'm gonna take some time off and do some charity work.

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: Are you sure, because we may have something at Louis Vuitton.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, screw charity work. What've you got?

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: Why don't we have dinner tonight and talk about it?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Great! I'll call ya!

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: Nice to see you.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah! yeah, I got tenure!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: See? I told you something good would come along. And he seemed really nice. I've met him before?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross! That's Mark. From Bloomingdales? You were insanely jealous of him.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That is Mark?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I hate that guy.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, no, NO, you cannot go to dinner with him.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What? You don't want me to get a job?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh yeah, I'm sure he's gonna give you a job. Maybe make you his SEXretary.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ugh.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I'm serious. I just don't trust that guy, okay?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross, you know what? Okay, let's talk about it later, there comes security.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, I love this street. The trees, the big front yards, the actual picket fences.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Man, those two dogs are going at it!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, where have you been?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, just er... you know, looking around. But you know what? This house... is great.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Really? What changed your mind?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh well, the little girl who lives here made me feel a lot better about the whole thing.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Joey, there was a little girl who lived here, but she died like 30 years ago.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ha! I'm just messing with you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That's not funny! You know I'm afraid of little girl ghosts!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey, now that you're okay with the house, do you wanna go see your room?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What? I get my own room?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You don't think we'd buy a house and not have a Joey room do you?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh my God! Oh! Hey, can I have an aquarium? And a sex swing?

utterance.speaker: Chandler and Monica
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Why not? I'll keep the tank clean.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: After you, miss Banana Hammock.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Thank you, mister Bag.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Oh hey, how are you?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh hi Rita! Good! Oh, Rita's a massage client.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Oh! Why don't you introduce me?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Er, Rita, this is my husband.

utterance.speaker: Rita
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Why don't you tell her my name?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, I will. This is my husband Crap Bag.

utterance.speaker: Rita
utterance.content: Crap Bag?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: If you need an easy way to remember it, just think of a bag of crap.

utterance.speaker: Rita
utterance.content: Okay. Excuse me...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah... Ogh... Okay, fine. You made your point. Can you please just be Mike Hannigan again?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Only if you'll be Phoebe Buffay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: How about uhm... How about Buffay-Hannigan?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah. I'm Phoebe Buffay-Hannigan Banana Hammock.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Do you even know what a banana hammock is?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It's a funny word.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: It's a Speedo.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: ...Oh crap!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, is Rachel here?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: She's still at dinner?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I guess. Why? Who's she with?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That guy Mark. From Bloomingdale's... She thinks he's just being nice to her. But I know he really wants to sleep with her.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It's seven years ago. My time machine works!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: We ran into him on the street today and he said he might have a job for her. But I know he just wants to get into her pants.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So what if he wants to sleep with her? I mean, she's single and he's cute.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh please! Yesterday on the subway? You couldn't stop staring at that woman with the big breasts the whole time.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: For your information, I was staring at her baby. We're about to be parents.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, sorry!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi you guys!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, so uhm... How was dinner?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, it was great. Mark is so sweet.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh yeah? Yeah? I wonder why? What could that smarmy letch possibly want?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh Ross, come on. He's happily married. His wife just had twins.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Should we send something?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: How did the job stuff go?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: He offered me one.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That's great!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Congratulations!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know, it's amazing. It's amazing. It's so much better than what I had at Ralph Lauren. The money is great...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Can we, can we just stop for a second? Who said something better would come along, huh? You didn't believe me. I told you everything was gonna work out. You know what? This calls for a bottle of Israel's finest.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: The job is in Paris.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I mean, this soap opera is a great gig, but... am I missing opportunities? You know, I've always thought of myself as a serious actor. I mean, should I be trying to do more independent movies?

utterance.speaker: Mackenzie
utterance.content: I don't know... You know what? I'm gonna put you on with my bear. Hold on.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey bear, I need some career advice.
